lines.text:
[realizing his gun is empty, as Foley points one at him]
You don't have an extra clip I can use, do you?
No, I don't.
You ain't never shot a gun before, have you?
Not until recently, no.
You nervous?
A little, yeah.
You know, in a situation like this, there's a high potentiality for the common motherfucker to bitch out.
So I figure, why take a chance?
[pulls the trigger]

It's like seeing someone for the first time, and you look at each other for a few seconds, and there's this kind of recognition like you both know something. Next moment the person's gone, and it's too late to do anything about it.
Hey! Sign says "shut the fuck up," or can't you fellas read?
[points to a sign that says "Quiet Please"]
The fuck you talkin' to man? You got a problem over there, Foley?
this is the dumbest fuckin' shakedown in the history of dumb shakedowns. Five hundred bucks for a pillow?
[Snoopy's prison bodyguard, Himey, threatens Jack]
Uh oh.
You're fucked up now, man. That's Himey. Protege of mine. Ranked number thirty-two in the federal prison system.
Thirty-two?
That's right.
Outta what? Twenty?
You wanted to tussle. We tussled.
Oh, man, if I wasn't stoned there is no way you would have talked me into this!
[with Karen's heel on his back]
Wow! You are mean!
What kind of name is Hejira?
It's Islamic.
What's it mean?
The Hejira was Mohammed's flight from Mecca in 632. Brothers in Leavenworth gave me that name.
You were in Leavenworth?
For a time.
What's that mean?
Means, when the time came, I left.
You broke out?
I prefer to think of it as an exodus from an undesirable place.
[Ray is wearing an "FBI" t-shirt]
Hey Ray, do you ever wear one that says "undercover"?

[pause]
No.
Bitch, what do you want to listen to?
I like Schubert.
Schubert? Well, I don't!
Well, the man don't just have to die, Foley. I mean, he could accidentally hurt himself falling down on something real hard, you know? Like a shiv, or my dick?
Is this your first time being robbed?
[Loretta nods]
You're doing great.
Alright, now I can say that I fucked a U.S. marshal. Do you think I will?
Here ma'am. Let me help you with these. Beautiful young lady like you shouldn't be carrying groceries. Let a man do that for you.
Now, I didn't ask you for help, so don't expect a tip.
Oh, that's okay ma'am. I'll just take your car.
[eavesdropping on Maurice trying to shakedown Ripley]
If you're smart, Ripley, you'll tell this guy to fuck off.
Really?
[Maurice gives him a threatening stare]
Well, I - I - I don't know.
First of all, if he kills you, then he's gonna get nothin'.
Well, uh, the man don't just have to die, Foley. I mean, he could accidentally hurt himself falling down on something real hard, you know. Like a shiv, or my dick.

[whispers to Foley]
I'll pay. I'll pay it. Don't worry.
If he falls on anything, Snoop, then they're transfer his ass outta here faster than you can throw a fight, and you're still gonna get nothin'.
You know, last time I checked, man, this shit over here ain't got nothin' to do with you, Foley. Why don't you go outside man? Smoke a cigarette or some shit?
I don't smoke.
You want to take her to my place, get cleaned up, come out of the bathroom with your aftershave on, and she goes "Oh! I had you all wrong."

Glenn, I know you are supposed to be cool and everything but you don't got to give me no tone of voice. You don't like what I'm saying, you just bounce the fuck up out of this whip anywhere along up in here man.
OK, I think we are forgetting this is my whip. I brought up here.

Shit, come on, Glenn, if I say this my car you know this my car, you just get yourself another one. If I say we in on this Ripley shit, we in on it, with or without your punk ass. If I say you gonna walk up in this house and do this motherfucker, so I can see if you got any balls or not, guess what else you gonna do. Tighten up your panties, boy.
Are those my suits?
Nah, these are MY suits!
[while eavesdropping on Miller trying to shakedown Ripley]
Five hundred bucks for a pillow?
That's right.

[to Foley]
It does seem a little high, doesn't it?
Shut up, Dick.
Buddy says Glenn thinks you guys are real cool.
He did, huh? Well, tell Buddy if I see Glenn wearing his sunglasses I'll step on 'em. I might not even take 'em off first.

I know a guy who walks into a bank with a little glass bottle. He tells everyone it's nitroglycerine. He scores some money off the teller, walks out. On his way out, the bottle breaks, he slips on it and knocks himself out. The "nitro" was Canola oil. I know more fucked-up bank robbers than ones who know what they're doing. I doubt if one in twenty could tell you where the dye pack is. Most bank robbers are fucking morons.
Tuffi was a good bitch, and I gave her what every good bitch wants, a bone.
[Opening a birthday gift from dad]
Oh my God, it's beautiful.
It's a um...
Sig-Sauer 380.
Right.
I love it, thanks Dad.
Hey bank robber! Hey, want some advice? Next time keep the engine running.
Give me a minute to talk to Buddy.
You got two minutes, that's all. Make up your mind, Foley.
I wasn't asking permission.
I've, uh, vertically integrated myself. You know, diversified and shit, and now I'm into the occasional grand larceny, home invasion... shit like that.
What's in this can?
That's for your breath. You could use it. Squirt some in your mouth.
Yeah, well that's mace, isn't it?
Yeah, so I read in the paper that this guy escapes from jail, ends up at this guy's wife's house and she lets him in. So he tells her his story and she feels, sorry for him, and they sleep together.
Yeah.
Yeah, so I guess that's how you score these days.
What are you going to do with a hatchet?
Fuck, fuck, fuck!
I think you flooded it.
Wanna hear a funny story?
Shut up and get out of the car!
Oh, that's right, you have my wallet. Why don't you come by the house, you can drop it off?
Sure, I'll leave it with the S.W.A.T. guy who answers the door.
Are you gonna go get him?
It's possible, why?
Well, I was thinking, you could have a nice time with him on the ride down - like picking up where your interlude or whatever you call it left off - and then you could throw him in the shit house!
Take your sunglasses off.
I see better with 'em on, man.
You don't take them off, I'm gonna throw them off the overpass while they're still on your head. Go wait in the car.
Um, we're in civilization now so you can ease up just a little bit.
I'm sorry! I'd like you to wait in the car please. Take her, put her in the back.
Okay... in the trunk?
IN THE BACKSEAT! IN THE BACKSEAT!
[interrupting a man who is rambling about his life, trying to pick her up in a bar]
Andy. Really... who gives a shit?
It was worse than you thought it would be, wasn't it? Yeah, you with the bad boys now, baby.
You're not dumb.

[starts to say something, then laughs]
Well, I don't know. You can't do three falls and say you have much of a brain.
You think there's a Hell?
Yeah, it's called the Glades Correctional Institute. I'm sure as shit not going back there, or anyplace like it.
Oh, they put a gun on you, you'll go.
They put a gun on you, you still have a choice.
You think I'll shoot you?
If you don't someone else will.
Put the gun down.
I'm not going back.
Jack please don't make me do this. Put the gun down.
No more timeouts.
I'm sale rep, and I came her to call on a customer, but they gave me a hard time, because I'm a girl.
Is that how you think of yourself?
As a sales rep?
As a girl...
[last lines]
I was supposed to leave last night with the lady Marshall, but for some reason she wanted to wait.
She did, huh?
I guess it's cheaper taking two of us down there in one van.
Could be. Or maybe she thought we had a lot to talk about.
Really? Like what?
I don't know. Long ride to Florida...
Where's your sunglasses? Did somebody finally step on them for you?
Oh, I see, you guys are cynical.
I got steaks!
You'd be surprised about what you can get, if you ask for it the right way.
